archimate:Device.name: Pick-to-Light System (P2LS)
archimate:Device.documentation:
(For Warehouse & Inventory Operations at St. Jude Hospital)
Intended Use:
Optimizes inventory picking, order fulfillment, restocking, and stocktaking in pharmacy, central supply, and general warehouse areas. Designed to improve accuracy, speed, and efficiency in item selection using visual indicators and confirmation buttons.
1. Hardware Specifications
Light Modules (Per Storage Location): • Indicator Type: o High-visibility multi-color LED lights (e.g., red, green, amber, blue) • Display: o Numeric or alphanumeric LCD/LED screen to show pick quantity or bin ID • Buttons: o Pick Confirm and Function buttons (for confirm, skip, short-pick, or restock actions) • Response Time: o Less than 1 second from system trigger to light activation • Power Supply: o 24V DC low-voltage (centralized or distributed power rails) • Mounting Options: o Snap-on rail mount or adjustable shelf brackets • Durability: o Rated for >1 million presses, IP30 minimum for indoor warehouse environments
Zone Controller (Per Aisle or Shelf Group):
• Purpose: o Manages and powers groups of light modules • Connectivity: o Ethernet (RJ-45) or RS-485 serial communication • Expansion Capacity: o Supports up to 100+ lights per controller • Power: o 110–240V AC input with 24V DC output to lights • Integration: o Connects to warehouse PC or server via LAN
2. System Integration
Control Software Requirements:
(Note: Not included in this infrastructure spec, but system must support future integration)
• API or Middleware Support: o Compatible with Warehouse Management System (WMS), Pharmacy Inventory System, or ERP • Communication Protocols: o REST API, MQTT, or proprietary driver • Data Sync Frequency: o Real-time or near real-time update capability
3. Functional Capabilities
• Supported Actions: o Pick, Put, Restock, Audit • Multiple Picks Display: o Shows quantity and bin ID • Batch or Wave Picking Support: o Light multiple bins for one operator • Error Prevention: o Alerts for incorrect confirmations or missed picks • Manual Override: o Physical override for system faults
4. Environment & Build
• Temperature Range: o 0°C to 40°C (standard warehouse indoor range) • Humidity: o 10%–90% non-condensing • Build Material: o ABS plastic or aluminum housing • Certifications: o CE, FCC, RoHS
5. Installation & Expandability
• Modular Design: o Lights and rails are modular and field-expandable • Cabling: o Daisy-chained low-voltage cabling with quick-connect plugs • Mounting Infrastructure: o Pre-drilled rail or shelf system support brackets
6. Power & Network Infrastructure Requirements (Contractor Scope)
• Power: o 220–240V AC outlets at regular intervals in warehouse zones (for controllers) • Cabling: o Cat6 Ethernet from controllers to main switch or server o Low-voltage wiring for light modules • Mounting Fixtures: o Rail support systems installed on all shelf faces designated for Pick-to-Light integration
Features:
• Audible Feedback: o Beeper for audio confirmation • Hands-Free Sensors: o Proximity or motion sensors for pick confirmation • Mobile Cart Integration: Portable pick-to-light kits for temporary zones or restocking carts
